heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 17 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and outside temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 384 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm), cloud levels (up 677 m), and light levels (down 3703 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 383.7m lower than yesterday, 49.8m lower than the past week, 677.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 702m and a peak of 2980m, averaging 1214.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, the air will feel quite humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
